data: Refer to OB Hemorrhage Algorithm for Birthing
Refer to OB Hemorrhage Algorithm for Postpartum
Bring Bakri / tamponade balloon to bedside unopened and MD to insert as needed
500 mL, IV, q20min, PRN bleeding, order duration: 6 doses or times, drug form: bag, first dose: STAT
1,000 mL, IV, q2h, PRN bleeding, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: bag, first dose: STAT
order rate: 125 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
1 g, IV, as directed, PRN bleeding, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.06 units/mL) in NS standard
titrate, IV, 75 milliunit/min starting rate, 50 milliunit/min minimum rate, 150 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate based on bleeding
oxytocin titratable infusion (0.04 units/mL) in NS
titrate, IV, 83 milliunit/min starting rate, 50 milliunit/min minimum rate, 133 milliunit/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate based on bleeding
50 mcg, IV, once, drug form: inj
100 mcg, IV, once, drug form: inj
Contraindicated in patients with hypertension OR patients with HIV on protease inhibitors.
0.25 mg, IM, as directed, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
0.125 mg, IV, as directed, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
For patients with renal, hepatic or cardiac disease, avoid the use of carboprost
For patients with asthma use caution in the use of carboprost
125 mcg, IM, q15min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
250 mcg, IM, q15min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
4 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose: NOW
2 mg, PO, q1h, PRN diarrhea, drug form: tab
This PowerPlan is for the ordering of labwork for a Massive Transfusion only. To initiate the Massive Transfusion Protocol, follow site-specific processes
Massive transfusion is anticipating needing 3 units or more of RBCs within the first hour
Inform blood bank that the Massive Transfusion Protocol has been initiated. Provide the blood bank with the patients' name, birth date and Medical Record Number
Bloodwork is only scheduled to occur for 3 hours. Order additional bloodwork as necessary beyond 3 hours
